snippet: New claims for unemployment benefits rose slightly after a big drop the week before, as businesses concerned about the so-called fiscal cliff remained cautious about hiring.
abstract: Labor Department says initial claims for state unemployment benefits rose 4,000 to a seasonally adjusted 367,000 in previous week; Commerce Department says new orders for manufactured goods fell 5.2 percent in August, biggest decline since January 2009.
lead_paragraph: New claims for unemployment benefits rose slightly after a big drop the week before, as businesses concerned about the so-called fiscal cliff remained cautious about hiring.

headline.seo: New Unemployment Claims Rise and Factory Orders Decline
headline.main: New Jobless Claims Rise; Factory Orders Decline
headline.print_headline: New Jobless Claims Rise; Factory Orders Decline
